# miterLimit

**Instance Property**

The limit at which miter joins are converted to bevel joins.

## Declaration

```swift
var miterLimit: CGFloat { get set }
```

## Discussion

The miter limit helps you avoid spikes at the junction of two line segments connected by a miter join ([doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMiterLineJoinStyle]). If the ratio of the miter length—the diagonal length of the miter join—to the line thickness exceeds the miter limit, the joint is converted to a bevel join.

The default value of this property is the value returned by the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSBezierPath/defaultMiterLimit] method.

## Related Documentation

- **defaultMiterLimit**: Returns the default miter limit for all paths.

- **windingRule**: The winding rule used to fill the path.
- **lineCapStyle**: The line cap style for the path.
- **lineJoinStyle**: The line join style for the path.
- **lineWidth**: The width of stroked path lines.

- **getLineDash(_:count:phase:)**: Returns the line-stroking pattern for the receiver.
- **setLineDash(_:count:phase:)**: Sets the line-stroking pattern for the path.
